name: inappreciable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If an amount or change is inappreciable, it is too small to be noticed or to have an important effect: Under the circumstances, the progress gained seemed inappreciable. Although a number of people may seem an inappreciable quantity when it represents just two percent of the local population, it is significant when it represents 100 percent of the population of a street.
More examplesFewer examplesThe factors that affect any observation are so inappreciable that it is impossible to repeat the experiment exactly.Any bad effect is at first inappreciable, but it is cumulative.
